page.title: 12ST.BARTHOLOMEW'S, GRIMLEY
page.content: The church stands at the northern end of the village street. It was founded 806 years ago. the oldest parts of the building are probably 12th century. The chancel is approx- imately a century older. The east window and tower are perpendicular. The other parts were added in 1886. The tower contains one of the oldest dated bells in England(1482). The Rev.P.H.Pollak is the vicar. He is also rector of Holt and Rural Dean of eighteen parishes. Services are held once and twice on alternate Sundays. Holy Communion is also held on Wednesday morning. The school also holds services in the church on festival occasions. In 1984 there were 24 christenings, approximately 10 weddings and 20 burials. It costs approximately Â£3000 to keep the church running.
